paragraphs.text: The Guardian view on talks between Angela Merkel and David Cameron.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: politics were like boxing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: meetings between national leaders would be arranged according to weight
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the asymmetrical world of international relations, however, disparity is the norm rather than the exception
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So it is with Angela Merkel and David Cameron
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who confer together in London on Wednesday
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The chancellor is the heavyweight contender
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while the prime minister would rate as middleweight at most
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The difference, unfortunately, is not just a reflection of the strength and size of the two countries concerned
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is also a measure of the stature of these two politicians
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mrs Merkel's characteristics - her steadiness, her careful thinking through of problems, her solid control of her party, her reluctance to move until she is sure of the right course, her refusal to play to the gallery - enhance Germany's influence in Europe and the world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With Mr Cameron, the reverse is true
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He has charm and a certain decency
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he is too easily blown off course by adverse winds arising within his own party and outside it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This has led him to take positions on Europe and immigration that could have been expressly designed to reduce our influence on our neighbours, ones that could lead to Britain departing the European Union
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That would leave the United Kingdom in an isolation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which it can be guessed Mr Cameron does not want
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: which he could nevertheless end up having brought about
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So it is
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as our former Berlin correspondent argues, he looks to Germany for rescue, hoping that Mrs Merkel's government will help craft changes in European regulations that Mr Cameron will then be able to present to his own party and to voters attracted by Ukip's nostrums as helping Britain control the flow of immigrants
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Whether such changes actually would have that effect in any longer term is another matter
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mr Cameron may not care too much about that, wanting only the appearance of concessions to help him out of the political corner into which he has painted himself
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Contrast Mrs Merkel's forthright remarks on the anti-Islamic demonstrations with which Germany is currently coping, with Mr Cameron's skirting of the moral aspects of the immigration debate to see the difference
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mrs Merkel has to manage a crammed portfolio of European problems
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Britain's difficulties are not at the top of the heap
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The most important general issue she faces is whether to stick with an unalloyed austerity programme that is becoming more and more politically explosive in southern Europe
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The most immediate specific question is how to cope with a possible change of government in Greece
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A more fundamental problem, in terms of the dynamics of the union, is how to prop up the old partnership with France
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And the most obvious external problem is how to manage Ukraine and Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Here, at least, Britain and Germany seem to be on the same page
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mrs Merkel is the strongest and most important leader in Europe
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: She is hardly beyond reproach
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The contradiction in her position is that at home she essentially governs as a social democrat, yet she operates as a neoliberal hawk abroad
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Her austerity drive can be said, at the very least, to be causing as many problems as it solves
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Her insistence on reform in Greece is vague when it should be detailed, leading to the suspicion that the problem is that, in German eyes, Greece can do nothing right
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Domestically, she often manages to "solve" political problems by simply sitting them out
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while her parliamentarians squabble and everyone gets bored of the subject and moves on
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That is how she dealt with the scandal of the NSA monitoring her mobile phone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: she largely kept quiet when many were hoping that she would raise her voice more loudly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But in broader foreign policy matters, that is not a working strategy in the long run
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Her dealings with Russia's President Vladimir Putin over the past year show signs of a learning curve
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: she has been not just quiet but quietly firm
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The world is still waiting for her to show similar leadership in the eurozone crisis
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But at least she is in a position to do so
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mr Cameron, however, has all but written himself out of the European script
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He is not a problem-solver, as Mrs Merkel is or could be, but a problem in himself for Europe, and yet another cross for the chancellor to bear
paragraphs.label: assumption
